sen.j: 小関三英（こせき さんえい、天明7年6月11日 (旧暦)（1787年7月25日） - 天保10年5月17日 (旧暦)（1839年6月27日））は、江戸時代後期の医者・蘭学者。
sen.e: Sanei KOSEKI (July 25, 1787 - June 27, 1839) was a doctor and a Dutch scholar during the late Edo Period.

sen.e: Although it had been believed that Sanei learned under Philipp Franz von Siebold, it became clear that there are no sources of evidence indicating that Sanei travelled to Nagasaki for learning and became a disciple of Siebold.

sen.e: Sanei learned Western studies from Choshuku YOSHIDA and Sajuro BABA, both Dutch doctors.

sen.j: 天保3年（1832年）、和泉国岸和田医となり、のち幕府の天文方阿蘭陀書籍和解御用、すなわち翻訳係となる。
sen.e: In 1832, Sanei became a doctor of Kishiwada of Izumi Province and was later appointed as a translator belonging to Tenmonkata (Astronomical Institute) of bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).

sen.e: During this period, Sanei got acquainted with Kazan WATANABE (a senior vassal of the Hahara Domain) and Choei TAKANO (a doctor and a Dutch scholar) and joined 'Shoshikai' to give a lecture on history and geography.

sen.j: 蛮社の獄の際、崋山・長英の入牢を聞き、自害する。
sen.e: When Bansha no goku (Imprisonment of scholars of Western learning) occurred, Sanei killed himself after being informed that Kazan and Choei were imprisoned.

sen.j: 崋山に「耶蘇伝」を口訳したことなどから連坐を恐れたものとされるが、三英には特に処罰される必然性はなく、自害は早計だったのではないか、とする意見もある。
sen.e: It is believed that Sanei killed himself for fear of the punishment by bakufu jointly with Kazan and Choei for translating 'Yasoden' (a book on Jesus Christ) into a colloquial speech, but some observers say that Sanei did not have to commit a suicide as there seems no logical ground for bakufu to punish him.
